IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: SERVING THE NEEDS OF LOW AND MODERATE INCOME PEOPLE THROUGH COMMUNITY ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES INCLUDING THE DEVELOPMENT AND MANAGEMENT OF AFFORDABLE RENTAL HOUSING, FIRST TIME HOME OWNERSHIP, AND COMMUNITY SELF- HELP ACTIVITIES WITHIN POLK COUNTY, OREGON, AND TO CARRY OUT SUCH ACTIVITIES AND BUSINESS AS MAY BE AUTHORIZED FOR A CORPORATION ORGANIZED UNDER THE OREGON NONPROFIT CORPORATION ACT AND AS A CORPORATION EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAX UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3).
IRS990.MissionDesc: SERVING THE NEEDS OF LOW AND MODERATE INCOME PEOPLE THROUGH COMMUNITY ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES INCLUDING THE DEVELOPMENT AND MANAGEMENT OF AFFORDABLE RENTAL HOUSING, FIRST TIME HOME OWNERSHIP, AND COMMUNITY SELF- HELP ACTIVITIES WITHIN POLK COUNTY, OREGON, AND TO CARRY OUT SUCH ACTIVITIES AND BUSINESS AS MAY BE AUTHORIZED FOR A CORPORATION ORGANIZED UNDER THE OREGON NONPROFIT CORPORATION ACT AND AS A CORPORATION EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAX UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3).
IRS990.Desc: TO DEVELOP, OPERATE AND PROVIDE SAFE, QUALITY, AND AFFORDABLE HOUSING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CORPORATION ACCOUNTS FOR TAX POSITIONS IN ACCORDANCE WITH FASB ACCOUNTING STANDARDS CODIFICATION TOPIC 740, INCOME TAXES. WITH FEW EXCEPTIONS, THE CORPORATION IS SUBJECT TO FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAX EXAMINATIONS BY TAX AUTHORITIES FOR THE PRIOR THREE YEARS. MANAGEMENT HAS REVIEWED THE CORPORATION'S TAX POSITIONS AND DETERMINED THERE WERE NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AS OF JUNE 30, 2022 AND 2021

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SELECTION CRITERIA IS DICTATED BY GRANT AGREEMENTS, AND APPLICATIONS WITH SUPPORTING DOCUMENTATION ARE REVIEWED AND VERIFIED TO ENSURE GRANTEE ELIGIBILITY. COSTS ARE PAID DIRECTLY TO SERVICE PROVIDERS WHEN APPLICABLE.

PART III, LINE 1: THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES PASS-THROUGH GRANTS FUNDS TO QUALIFYING LOW- INCOME HOMEOWNERS FOR THEIR RESIDENCE REHABILITATION. PART III, LINE 2: CAROL HENSLEY MEMORIAL CHILDREN'S ASSITANCE FUND AND VETERANS HOUSING ASSISTANCE.

SERVING THE NEEDS OF LOW AND MODERATE INCOME PEOPLE THROUGH COMMUNITY ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES INCLUDING THE DEVELOPMENT AND MANAGEMENT OF AFFORDABLE RENTAL HOUSING, FIRST TIME HOME OWNERSHIP, AND COMMUNITY SELF- HELP ACTIVITIES WITHIN POLK COUNTY, OREGON, AND TO CARRY OUT SUCH ACTIVITIES AND BUSINESS AS MAY BE AUTHORIZED FOR A CORPORATION ORGANIZED UNDER THE OREGON NONPROFIT CORPORATION ACT AND AS A CORPORATION EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAX UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3).
THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE FINANCE DEPARTMENT AND THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. A COPY IS PROVIDED TO THE BOARD PRIOR TO FILING.
ANY ACTIONS BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS REQUIRE THE BOARD TO DISCLOSE CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. IF A CONFLICT THE BOARD MEMBER IS EXCLUDED FROM PARTICIPATING ANY VOTE REGARDING THAT ACTION.
COMPENSATION FOR THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR IS ESTABLISHED AND PERIODICALLY REVIEWED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

OFFICERS OTHER THAN THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR SERVE AS VOLUNTEERS WITHOUT COMPENSATION. OTHER EMPLOYEE COMPENSATION IS DETERMINED USING COMPARABLE DATA FROM OTHER SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.
GOVERNING DOCUMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC AT THE ORGANIZATIONS OFFICES UPON REQUEST.
